dalserver

Class Param

  • java.lang.Object
    • dalserver.Param

  • public class Param
extends java.lang.Object
    The Param (parameter) class is used to store a runtime parameter instance, e.g., a GET/POST request parameter input to a DAL service. This is a minimal version of the parameter mechanism and does not attempt to be fully general, or serve cases other than service request parameters. Our focus here is on a runtime parameter instance with minimal metadata.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.String description
      Brief description of parameter.
      protected boolean isSet
      Set to true if the parameter was set explicitly by the client request, as opposed to a default value being set.
      protected ParamLevel level
      The level of a parameter, e.g., "core" (defined by the relevant standard), "extension" (an extension defined or supported by the service), or "client" (a parameter added by the client, which the service does not recognize as belonging either to the core or and extension)..
      protected java.lang.String name
      The parameter name.
      protected java.util.EnumSet<ParamType> type
      The parameter type (enumeration).
      protected java.lang.String value
      The value of a String parameter, or null if no value has been set.

    • Field Detail

      • name

        protected java.lang.String name
        The parameter name.

      • type

        protected java.util.EnumSet<ParamType> type
        The parameter type (enumeration).

      • value

        protected java.lang.String value
        The value of a String parameter, or null if no value has been set. Clients should not change the value of a parameter directly; use the setValue method instead.

      • level

        protected ParamLevel level
        The level of a parameter, e.g., "core" (defined by the relevant standard), "extension" (an extension defined or supported by the service), or "client" (a parameter added by the client, which the service does not recognize as belonging either to the core or and extension)..

      • description

        protected java.lang.String description
        Brief description of parameter.

      • isSet

        protected boolean isSet
        Set to true if the parameter was set explicitly by the client request, as opposed to a default value being set.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Param

        public Param(java.lang.String name,
     java.util.EnumSet<ParamType> type,
     java.lang.String value,
     ParamLevel level,
     boolean isSet,
     java.lang.String descr)
      throws DalServerException
        Create a new Param instance.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        type - The parameter type (see ParamType).
        value - The parameter value, represented as a string.
        level - The parameter standardization level.
        isSet - Parameter was set explicitly by the client.
        descr - Short description of the parameter.
        Throws:
        DalServerException

      • Param

        public Param(java.lang.String name,
     java.util.EnumSet<ParamType> type,
     java.lang.String descr)
      throws DalServerException
        Simple constructor to define a new CORE (standard) parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        type - The parameter type (see ParamType).
        descr - Short description of the parameter. This method is used to construct new, default parameter sets containing only predefined standard parameters with the values not yet set (except in the case of a default value). Hence value is null, level is CORE, and isSet is false.
        Throws:
        DalServerException

      • Param

        public Param(java.lang.String name,
     java.util.EnumSet<ParamType> type,
     java.lang.String value,
     java.lang.String descr)
      throws DalServerException
        Simple constructor to define a new CORE parameter with a default value.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        type - The parameter type (see ParamType).
        value - The default value of the parameter.
        descr - Short description of the parameter. When a parameter is created with a default value, value will be non-null, but isSet will be false to indicate that the value was not explicitly set.
        Throws:
        DalServerException

      • Param

        public Param(java.lang.String name,
     java.lang.String value,
     ParamLevel level)
      throws DalServerException
        Simple constructor for a simple String-valued parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The default value of the parameter.
        level - The parameter level (see ParamLevel) This constructor is used to define non-standard string parameters, particularly system parameters (level=ParamLevel.SERVICE).
        Throws:
        DalServerException

      • Param

        public Param(java.lang.String name,
     java.lang.String value)
      throws DalServerException
        Simple constructor for a simple String-valued parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The parameter value, represented as a string. This method is called when processing request parameters to add a new client-specified parameter which does not match any predefined standard or extension parameter. Such parameters are always string valued and there is no description string available. Hence type=String, level=CLIENT, isSet=true.
        Throws:
        DalServerException

      • Param

        public Param(Param param)
      throws DalServerException
        Simple constructor to create a new copy of an existing parameter.
        Parameters:
        param - Some existing parameter. A new copy of all parameter data is created, but attributes like the parameter name, type, etc. are merely referenced.
        Throws:
        DalServerException

        Parameters:
